                  <form>       
                     <itype>6</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">تَمَاثَلَ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He became nearly in a sound,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">healthy, state;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near to convalescence:</hi> (K:) or <hi rend="ital">he became more like the sound,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">healthy, than the unsound,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unhealthy, who is suffering from a chronic and pervading disease;</hi> (TA;) or so <foreign lang="ar">تماثل لِلْبُرْءِ</foreign>. (M.) Said also of a wound: (T, S in art. <foreign lang="ar">دمل</foreign>:) and of a disease; like <foreign lang="ar">أَشْكَلَ</foreign>. (TA, art. <foreign lang="ar">شكل</foreign>.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">تَمَاثَلَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">تَشَابَهَا</foreign>. (M, K in art. <foreign lang="ar">سوى</foreign>.)    </entryFree>26:T49c,<entryFree id="n43506" key="مِثْلٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">مِثْلٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">A like; a similar person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing; match; fellow; an analogue.</hi> (K, &amp;c.) See <foreign lang="ar">نِدٌّ</foreign> and voce <foreign lang="ar">بَدَلٌ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">A likeness, resemblance,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">semblance;</hi> see <foreign lang="ar">شَبَهٌ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">An equivalent; a requital.</hi>          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">مِثْلَ</foreign>, used as a denotative of state, means <hi rend="ital">Like.</hi> Ex. <foreign lang="ar">مَرَّ مِثْلَ البَرْقِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He passed like the lightning.</hi> See an ex. in the Kur li. 23; and another, from Sakhr-el-Gheí, voce <foreign lang="ar">فَرْضٌ</foreign>.    </entryFree>27:T8ed,<entryFree id="n43507" key="مَثَلٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">مَثَلٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">صِفَةٌ</foreign> [as meaning <hi rend="ital">A description, condition, state, case,</hi> &amp;c.]; (S, K, &amp;c.;) or <foreign lang="ar">وَصْفٌ</foreign> [meaning the same]: (Msb:) or this is a mistake: (Mbr, AAF, TA:) or it may be a tropical signification: (MF, TA:) for in the language of the Arabs it means <hi rend="ital">a description by way of comparison:</hi> (AAF, TA:) you say <foreign lang="ar">مثل زيد مثل</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">فلان</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The description of Zeyd, by way of comparison,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the condition, &amp;c., is that of such a one</hi>]: it is from <foreign lang="ar">المِثاَلُ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">الحَذْوُ</foreign>: (Mbr, TA:) it is metaphorically applied to <hi rend="ital">a condition, state,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">case,</hi> that is important, strange, or wonderful. (Ksh, Bd in ii. 16.) The phrase here given is more literally, and better, rendered, <hi rend="ital">The similitude of Zeyd is the similitude,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is that, of such a one;</hi> for a similitude is a description by way of comparison.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  You say also, <foreign lang="ar">جَعَلَهُ مَثَلًا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">لِكَذَا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He made it</hi> (an expression or the like) <hi rend="ital">to be descriptive, by way of comparison, of such a thing</hi>]. (TA passim.) [And <foreign lang="ar">مَثَلٌ لِكَذَا</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">An expression denoting, by way of similitude, such a thing.</hi>]          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">عَلَى المَثَلِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">As indicative of resemblance</hi> to something.          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  See <foreign lang="ar">بَدَلٌ</foreign>.    </entryFree>28:T4d8,<entryFree id="n43508" key="مِثَالٌ" type="main">

                  <hi rend="ital">Quality, made, manner, fashion,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">form;</hi> (Msb;) <hi rend="ital">a model according to which another thing is made or proportioned; a pattern,</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">مِقْدَارٌ</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">by which a thing is measured, proportioned, or cut out:</hi> (T:) <hi rend="ital">an example</hi> of a class <pb n="3018"/> of words, of a rule, &amp;c.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">مِنْ غَيْرِ سَبْقِ مِثاَلٍ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Without there having been any precedent</hi>]. (Msb in art. <foreign lang="ar">قرح</foreign>, &amp;c.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  [<hi rend="ital">A bed:</hi>] <foreign lang="ar">بَناَتُ المِثَالِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The daughters of the bed;</hi> meaning <hi rend="ital">women.</hi> (T in art. <foreign lang="ar">بنى</foreign>.)
